description.intro: Basil is a fragrant herb commonly used in cooking and traditional medicine.
description.water: Keep soil consistently moist, water when the top inch feels dry.
description.pet_friendly: Yes, Basil is non-toxic to pets.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Basil is a great herb for beginners to grow in both indoor and outdoor environments.

how_to_plant: Plant in well-draining soil in a sunny location or container.

watering.description: Water regularly to keep the soil slightly moist.

light.description: Requires full sun to grow properly.

fertilizer.description: Feed with a balanced fertilizer every 2 weeks.

faqs.question: How often should I water Basil?
faqs.answer: Water regularly, keeping the soil consistently moist but not soggy.

faqs.question: Does Basil need sunlight?
faqs.answer: Yes, Basil needs at least 6 hours of direct sunlight daily.

faqs.question: Is Basil pet friendly?
faqs.answer: Yes, Basil is non-toxic to pets.

faqs.question: Can I grow Basil indoors?
faqs.answer: Yes, place it near a sunny window or under grow lights.

faqs.question: How can I use Basil?
faqs.answer: Basil is great in salads, pastas, and for making pesto.

description.pet_friendly: Yes, Mint is safe for pets, but it is important to note that some pets may not enjoy the strong scent.

how_to_plant: Plant in well-draining soil in a sunny location or container.

watering.description: Water regularly to keep the soil slightly moist.

light.description: Requires full sun to grow properly.

fertilizer.description: Feed with a balanced fertilizer every 2 weeks.

faqs.question: How often should I water Mint?
faqs.answer: Water frequently to keep the soil moist.

faqs.question: Does Mint need sunlight?
faqs.answer: It prefers partial sunlight but tolerates full sun.

faqs.answer: Yes, mint is generally considered safe for pets in small quantities.

description.water: Keep soil consistently moist, water when the top inch feels dry.
description.pet_friendly: Yes, Parsley is safe for pets, but it should be used in moderation for pet consumption.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Parsley is a low-maintenance herb that's easy to grow, even for beginners.

how_to_plant: Plant in well-draining soil in a sunny location or container.

watering.description: Water regularly to keep the soil slightly moist.

light.description: Requires full sun to grow properly.

fertilizer.description: Feed with a balanced fertilizer every 2 weeks.

faqs.question: How often should I water Parsley?
faqs.answer: Water when the top of the soil feels dry, usually every 2-3 days.

faqs.question: Does Parsley need sunlight?
faqs.answer: Yes, it grows best with 5-6 hours of sunlight daily.

faqs.question: Is Parsley pet friendly?
faqs.answer: Yes, Parsley is safe for pets in moderation.

faqs.question: Can I grow Parsley indoors?
faqs.answer: Yes, place it on a sunny windowsill or under grow lights.

faqs.question: How can I use Parsley?
faqs.answer: Use it as a garnish or in soups, salads, and sauces.

description.intro: Basil is a fragrant herb commonly used in cooking and traditional medicine.
description.water: Keep soil consistently moist, water when the top inch feels dry.
description.pet_friendly: Yes, Oregano is non-toxic to pets, but it can cause gastrointestinal upset if ingested in large amounts.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Oregano is a resilient plant, easy to grow for beginners, and a great addition to any herb garden.

how_to_plant: Plant in well-draining soil in a sunny location or container.

watering.description: Water regularly to keep the soil slightly moist.

light.description: Requires full sun to grow properly.

fertilizer.description: Feed with a balanced fertilizer every 2 weeks.

faqs.question: How often should I water Oregano?
faqs.answer: Water when the soil feels dry, about once a week.

faqs.question: Does Oregano need sunlight?
faqs.answer: Yes, it prefers full sun for 6-8 hours a day.

faqs.question: Is Oregano pet friendly?
faqs.answer: In small amounts, it is safe; large quantities may cause mild issues.

faqs.question: Can I grow Oregano indoors?
faqs.answer: Yes, just ensure it gets plenty of light.

faqs.question: How can I use Oregano?
faqs.answer: Use in Italian dishes, sauces, and marinades.

description.intro: Basil is a fragrant herb commonly used in cooking and traditional medicine.
description.water: Keep soil consistently moist, water when the top inch feels dry.
description.pet_friendly: Yes, Chives are non-toxic to pets, but they should be kept away from cats and dogs in large quantities due to possible digestive issues.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Chives are one of the easiest herbs to grow and are a perfect choice for beginners.

how_to_plant: Plant in well-draining soil in a sunny location or container.

watering.description: Water regularly to keep the soil slightly moist.

light.description: Requires full sun to grow properly.

fertilizer.description: Feed with a balanced fertilizer every 2 weeks.

faqs.question: How often should I water Chives?
faqs.answer: Water when the soil feels dry on top, typically every 2-3 days.

faqs.question: Does Chives need sunlight?
faqs.answer: Yes, it prefers full sun but can tolerate partial shade.

faqs.question: Is Chives pet friendly?
faqs.answer: No, chives are toxic to cats and dogs if consumed in large amounts.

faqs.question: Can I grow Chives indoors?
faqs.answer: Yes, chives grow well in pots on sunny windowsills.

faqs.question: How can I use Chives?
faqs.answer: Use them fresh in salads, soups, eggs, and as garnish.
